title: UnitedHealth Raises Earnings Outlook as Quarterly Revenue Up 13%; Health-insurance company posts double-digit revenue growth in Optum, UnitedHealthcare units
text:
The company, based in Minnetonka, Minn., also raised its full-year earnings guidance. It now expects full-year earnings of $20.45 a share to $20.95 a share, up 15 cents on either end from its prior guidance. On an adjusted basis, the outlook calls for earnings of $21.40 a share to $21.90 a share, up 20 cents on both ends of the range.

UnitedHealth's medical-care ratio, a closely watched measure of the proportion of premiums going to medical care, was 81.5%, down from 82.8% a year ago and below analysts' expectations.

Profit for the quarter ended June 30 came in at $5.07 billion, or $5.34 a share, compared with $4.27 billion, or $4.46 a share, a year earlier. Excluding amortization and tax effects, profit came in at $5.57 a share. Analysts polled by FactSet were expecting adjusted earnings of $5.21 a share.

Revenue came in at $80.3 billion, ahead of estimates for $79.7 billion.

The company's UnitedHealthcare insurance business saw revenue grow almost 12% in the second quarter to $62.11 billion. The business added 280,000 members last quarter, with growth in community-based and senior offerings, leading the increase.

UnitedHealth's Optum health-services arm notched nearly 18% revenue growth in the period, with revenue rising to $45.08 billion.

Write to Will Feuer at will.feuer@wsj.com

UnitedHealth Raises Earnings Outlook as Quarterly Revenue Up 13%
